result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Andres Altamirano

records.addlTxt: Upon request from Defense, Court rescheduled status conference to December 19, 2022 at 1:30 PM in Branch 2, Rm 635 CH.  Parties notified of court date.
Received and Filed: Letter to Adjourn Hearing on 12/12/22

Defendant Andres Altamirano not in court, in custody.  Attorney Leah R. Thomas in court for Andres Altamirano.  Attorney Amanda Kirklewski in court on behalf of Attorney James C Griffin for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for a status conference.  State is waiting for discovery and requests another status conference.  Court scheduled the matter as requested.  Court approves Zoom appearances at the next court date.  Case adjourned to Branch 2, Rm 635 CH.
Status conference scheduled for December 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Andres Altamirano not in court, in custody.  Attorney Leah R. Thomas appeared by video for Andres Altamirano.  Prosecuting attorney James C Griffin in court for the State of Wisconsin. Scheduling conference held. Defense needs discovery and is requesting a status. Case is adjourned in Branch 02.
Status conference scheduled for October 19, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Andres Altamirano in court, appear by video with attorney Leah R. Thomas, appear by video.  Defendant Andres Altamirano in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.
  Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 02, Judge Childs. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 02.  Scheduling conference scheduled for September 15, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Andres Altamirano in court with attorney Leah R. Thomas.  Defendant Andres Altamirano in custody.  Gregg Herman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Andres Altamirano appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Childs, Branch 02.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 1, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Adjustment Number: 22A 068730,
Payable Number: 1021382,
Receipt Number: 22RP029555,
Amount: $20.00
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
